description: From Middle English product, from Latin prōductus, perfect participle of prōdūcō, first attested in English in the mathematics sense.

entries.meaning: Anything that is produced; a result.
(countable, uncountable) A commodity offered for sale.
(cosmetics, uncountable) Any preparation to be applied to the hair, skin, nails, etc. Often specifically a preparation used to hold one's hair in a desired arrangement.
(US, slang) Illegal drugs, especially cocaine, when viewed as a commodity.

definitionGroups.group: Anything that is produced; a result.

entries.meaning: The amount of an artifact that has been created by someone or some process.
examples: They improve their product every year; they export most of their agricultural production.
Synonyms: endwork, production, output, creation, yield

entries.meaning: A consequence of someone's efforts or of a particular set of circumstances.
examples: Skill is the product of hours of practice.  His reaction was the product of hunger and fatigue.

entries.meaning: (chemistry) A chemical substance formed as a result of a chemical reaction.
examples: This is a product of lime and nitric acid.

entries.meaning: (arithmetic) A quantity obtained by multiplication of two or more numbers.
examples: The product of 2 and 3 is 6.  The product of 2, 3, and 4 is 24.

entries.meaning: (mathematics) Any operation or a result thereof which generalises multiplication of numbers, like the multiplicative operation in a ring, product of types or a categorical product.
Any tangible or intangible good or service that is a result of a process and that is intended for delivery to a customer or end user.
(countable, uncountable) A commodity offered for sale.
examples: That store offers a variety of products.  We've got to sell a lot of product by the end of the month.

entries.meaning: (cosmetics, uncountable) Any preparation to be applied to the hair, skin, nails, etc. Often specifically a preparation used to hold one's hair in a desired arrangement.
examples: Wash excess product out of your hair.

entries.meaning: (US, slang) Illegal drugs, especially cocaine, when viewed as a commodity.
examples: I got some product here – you buying?

verbs.description: product (third-person singular simple present products, present participle producting, simple past and past participle producted)

examples: The probate of a Testament is the producting and insinuating of it before the Ecclesiastical Judge  […]
